definitions.definition: the movement or direction of an object as it travels through the air

definitions.definition: a series of steps between two floors or levels

examples.text: She fell down **a flight of stairs/steps** and hurt her back.

definitions.definition: the act of running away from a dangerous or difficult situation
definitions.sensetop: flight (of somebody) (from somebody/something)in flight from something

definitions.definition: an idea or a statement that shows a lot of imagination but is not practical or sensible

definitions.definition: to force somebody to run away

examples.text: The enemy was quickly put to flight.
The gang took flight when they heard the police car.

wordOrigin: Old English flyht ‘action or manner of flying’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vlucht and fly (verb). This was probably merged in Middle English with an unrecorded Old English word related to German Flucht and to flee, which is represented by sense 6 of the noun.
